caption: Table 3c - A03: Software Supply Chain Failures Coverage by AWS Security Agent*
note: * The evaluation was conducted against a sample simplified applications with known vulnerabilities. As a result, additional weaknesses or architectural limitations commonly observed in real-world, large-scale applications may not be represented. Analysis of such scenarios is outside the scope of this research.
rows: CWE-1035: OWASP Top Ten 2017 Category A9 - Using Components with Known Vulnerabilities

Description: The service tests for dependency version pinning and integrity verification, which indirectly helps identify when components may have known vulnerabilities by ensuring proper version tracking. Evidence: Improper inventory management action groups test for dependency version pinning and integrity verification in Dockerfiles and build configurations. Limitations: Explicit CVE scanning and vulnerability database lookups are not performed, limiting the ability to identify known vulnerabilities in components [UL-009].
CWE-1104: Use of Unmaintained Third Party Components

Description: The service does not test for unmaintained third-party components. Evidence: Comprehensive review of penetration test runs found no evidence of testing for component maintenance status, end-of-life dates, or deprecation notices. Limitations: Maintenance status checking is completely absent from the testing scope [UL-009].
CWE-1329: Reliance on Component That is Not Updateable

Description: The service includes dedicated testing for dependency version pinning and integrity verification that systematically identifies when components are not properly pinned. Evidence: Improper inventory management action groups test for Docker base image version pinning using SHA256 digest and component integrity verification through checksum validation.
CWE-1395: Dependency on Vulnerable Third-Party Component

Description: The service tests for dependency version pinning and integrity verification, which helps identify when third-party components are not properly tracked. Evidence: Improper inventory management action groups test for dependency version pinning and integrity verification in Dockerfiles and build configurations. Limitations: Explicit vulnerability scanning of third-party components and checking against vulnerability databases are not performed [UL-009].
CWE-447: Unimplemented or Unsupported Feature in UI

Description: The service does not test for unimplemented or unsupported UI features. Evidence: Comprehensive review of penetration test runs found no evidence of testing for UI feature completeness. Limitations: UI feature completeness testing is not included in the testing scope [UL-007].

Description: The service does not test for obsolete function usage. Evidence: Comprehensive review of penetration test runs found no evidence of testing for obsolete function usage in code. Limitations: Obsolete function detection is not included in the testing scope [UL-008].
